myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    myMath.cont_function, myMath.function, myMath.Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements myMath.Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Shayke Shok and Itay Grinblat

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polynom()
      Empty constructor
      Polynom(Polynom p)
      Constructor that get a polynom and copy him to this Polynom
      Polynom(java.lang.String s)
      Constructor that get a string and make from it a Polynom We get only format like it: a1x^b1+a2x^b2+a3x^b3...

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(myMath.Monom m)
      The function get a monom and add it to the polynom if the monom already exists we add the coefficient to the existing monom if the sum of the coefficient of the two monoms is equal to zero we remove it from the polynom

      The function get a polynom and multiply it with the exist polynom
      double root(double Xleft, double Xright, double eps)
      Compute a value x' (x0<=x'<=x1) for with |f(x')| < eps assuming (f(x0)*f(x1)<=0, returns f(x2) such that: * (i) x0<=x2<=x2 && (ii) f(x2)
      void substract(myMath.Monom m)
      The function get a monom and sub it from the polynom if there is monom already exists with power equal to this power monom we sub the coefficient to the existing monom if the sum of the coefficient of the two monoms is equal to zero we remove it from the polynom

      • root

        public double root(double Xleft,
                   double Xright,
                   double eps)
            throws myMath.DataException,
                   myMath.RootException
        Compute a value x' (x0<=x'<=x1) for with |f(x')| < eps assuming (f(x0)*f(x1)<=0, returns f(x2) such that: * (i) x0<=x2<=x2 && (ii) f(x2)
        Specified by:
        root in interface myMath.Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - step (positive) value
        Returns:
        the root
        Throws:
        myMath.DataException
        myMath.RootException
